title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story about the Jazz Age and the decline of the American Dream.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners set in early 19th century England.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about totalitarianism and mass surveillance.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl's view of racial injustice in the Deep South.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society driven by technology and social engineering.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A sailor's narrative of the obsessive quest to hunt a giant white whale.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A young man's experiences of alienation and rebellion.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
description: A young woman's journey to find love and independence.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A hobbit's adventure to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first part of the epic journey to destroy the One Ring.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young wizard's first year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist uncovers secrets hidden in works of art.

title: Angels and Demons
author: Dan Brown
description: A race against time to stop a secret society from destroying the Vatican.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A shepherd's journey to find his personal legend.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption in Afghanistan.
